capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape does have that distinctive eagle-hook nose, doesn't he? I mean, it's quite striking. (pauses) He's always been a bit of an intimidating figure at Hogwarts, and that nose is definitely one of his distinguishing features.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and often conflicted personality. His strict demeanor and sharp tongue can be quite intimidating at times, but there's also a depth to him that makes him more than just a one-dimensional villain.

Snape, the way he's always been portrayed as this intimidating figure in the wizarding world is quite a misconception. I mean, have you seen his backstory? He was a victim of bullying and abuse himself, which makes him all the more relatable. But at the same time, his harsh demeanor can be off-putting, especially to those who don't know him.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what does the attribute that snape is known for casting spell wise?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to Dudley the other day and I have to say, he can be a bit... self-centered. He has this personality that's really focused on himself, which is why people might describe him as selfish.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to Dudley the other day and he told me that he's 11 years old. I completely agree with him, I'm certain about it. He seems like a responsible kid for his age, doesn't he?
